public void angleInterpolationBezier(java.util.List<java.lang.String> jointNames,
                                     java.lang.Object times,
                                     java.lang.Object controlPoints)
                              throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
Interpolates a sequence of timed angles for several motors using bezier control points. This is a blocking call.

Parameters:
jointNames - A vector of joint names
times - An ragged ALValue matrix of floats. Each line corresponding to a motor, and column element to a control point.
controlPoints - An ALValue array of arrays each containing [float angle, Handle1, Handle2], where Handle is [int InterpolationType, float dAngle, float dTime] descibing the handle offsets relative to the angle and time of the point. The first bezier param describes the handle that controls the curve preceeding the point, the second describes the curve following the point.

com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError

animation

public void animation(java.util.List<java.lang.String> jointNames,
                      java.lang.Object times,
                      java.lang.Object controlPoints,
                      java.lang.Object isAbsolute,
                      java.lang.Object supportSequence)
               throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
Interpolates a sequence of timed angles for several motors using bezier control points. This is a blocking call.

Parameters:
jointNames - A vector of joint names
times - An ragged ALValue matrix of floats. Each line corresponding to a motor, and column element to a control point.
controlPoints - An ALValue array of arrays each containing [float angle, Handle1, Handle2], where Handle is [int InterpolationType, float dAngle, float dTime] descibing the handle offsets relative to the angle and time of the point. The first bezier param describes the handle that controls the curve preceeding the point, the second describes the curve following the point.
isAbsolute - A bool or a vector of bool. If true, the movement is described in absolute angles, else the angles are relative to the current angle.
supportSequence - An alvalue containing a list of [nameEffector, timeList, isActiveList].

getFootSteps

public java.lang.Object getFootSteps()
                              throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
Get the foot steps. This is a non-blocking call.

Returns:
Give two list of foot steps. The first one give the unchangeable foot step. The second list give the changeable foot steps. Il you use setFootSteps or setFootStepsWithSpeed with clearExisting parmater equal true, walk engine execute unchangeable foot step and remove the other.

wbEnable

public void wbEnable(java.lang.Boolean isEnabled)
              throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                     java.lang.InterruptedException
UserFriendly Whole Body API: enable Whole Body Balancer. It's a Generalized Inverse Kinematics which deals with cartesian control, balance, redundancy and task priority. The main goal is to generate and stabilized consistent motions without precomputed trajectories and adapt nao's behaviour to the situation. The generalized inverse kinematic problem takes in account equality constraints (keep foot fix), inequality constraints (joint limits, balance, ...) and quadratic minimization (cartesian / articular desired trajectories). We solve each step a quadratic programming on the robot.

Parameters:
isEnabled - Active / Disactive Whole Body Balancer.
Throws:
com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError
java.lang.InterruptedException

                 throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException

Parameters:
stateName - Name of the foot state. "Fixed" set the foot fixed. "Plane" constrained the Foot in the plane. "Free" set the foot free.
supportLeg - Name of the foot. "LLeg", "RLeg" or "Legs".
Throws:
com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError
java.lang.InterruptedException

                          throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException
Advanced Whole Body API: stiffness of Joint used in Whole Body Optimization criteria. It is the stiffness of Joint motion control used in the quadratic programming optimization.

stateName - "referencePosture" : the reference posture specified possibleredundancy or "articularControl" : for joint motion(angleInterpolation for example). "All", the both.
stiffness - Stiffness used in the Whole Body Articular Optimization.Limits : 0 < stiffness <= 100.0. "referencePosture" default value : 1.0."articularControl" default value : 30.0.

_wbSetArticularLimitPreview

public void _wbSetArticularLimitPreview(java.lang.String jointName,
                                        java.lang.Integer stateName)
                                 throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
Advanced Whole Body API: preview of Joint Inequality Constraint. It constraint the max joint velocity computed by the quadratic programming. If preview = 1, joint limits can be achieved in 1 step. If preview = 5, joint limits can be achieved in 5 steps. The more preview is, the less desired motion is realised. But the more preview is, the motion safety is increased.

Parameters:
jointName - Name or names of joints, chains, "Body" or "Joints".
stateName - "referencePosture" : the reference posture specified possibleredundancy or "articularControl" : for joint edition (angleInterpolation for example)."All", the both.
preview - Preview used in the Whole Body Inequality Constraints. Between [1 50]."referencePosture" default value : 1. "articularControl" default value : 1.
Throws:
com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError
java.lang.InterruptedException

                                        java.lang.Boolean isActive,

                                        java.lang.InterruptedException

Parameters:
effectorName - Name of the effector : "All", "Arms", "Legs", "Head", "LArm", "RArm", "LLeg", "RLeg", "Torso", "Com".
isActive - if true, the effector control is taken in acount in the optimization criteria.
axisMask - True for axes that you wish to control. e.g. 7 for position only, 56 for rotation only and 63 for both.
Throws:
com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError
java.lang.InterruptedException

_wbSetEffectorWeight

public void _wbSetEffectorWeight(java.lang.String effectorName,
                                 java.lang.Object weightingList)
                          throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException
Advanced Whole Body API: set Effector Weighting in the Whole Body Optimization. It is the priority of Effector motion in front of all the other motion task in the quadratic programming optimization.

Parameters:
effectorName - "All", "Arms", "Legs", "Head", "LArm", "RArm", "LLeg", "RLeg", "Torso", "Com".
weightingList - Weighting used in the Whole Body Cartesian Optimization. Limits : 0 < weighting <= 1000.0. Default value is 1000.0. We can give the 6 weights corresponding to the 6 degree of freedom of cartesian motion. (WeightX, WeightY, WeightZ, WeightWX, WeightWY, WeightWZ). We can give 2 weights corresponding to translation and rotation axis (WeightTranslation, WeightTranslation, WeightTranslation, WeightRotation, WeightRotation, WeightRotation). We can give 1 weight, it is the same weight for all the axis (Weight, Weight, Weight, Weight, Weight, Weight).
Throws:
com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError
java.lang.InterruptedException

_wbSetEffectorStiffness

public void _wbSetEffectorStiffness(java.lang.String effectorName,
                                    java.lang.Object stiffnessList)
                             throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Advanced Whole Body API: set Effector Stiffness in Cartesian Control.

Parameters:
effectorName - "All", "Arms", "Legs", "Head", "LArm", "RArm", "LLeg", "RLeg", "Torso", "Com".
stiffnessList - Stiffness used in the Whole Body Cartesian Optimization. Limits : 0 < stiffness <= 100.0. Default value is 10.0. We can give the 6 stiffnesses corresponding to the 6 degree of freedom of cartesian motion. (StiffnessX, StiffnessY, StiffnessZ, StiffnessWX, StiffnessWY, StiffnessWZ). We can give 2 weights corresponding to translation and rotation axis (StiffnessTranslation, StiffnessTranslation, StiffnessTranslation, StiffnessRotation, StiffnessRotation, StiffnessRotation). We can give 1 stiffness, it is the same stiffness for all the axis (Stiffness, Stiffness, Stiffness, Stiffness, Stiffness, Stiffness).
Throws:
com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError
java.lang.InterruptedException

public java.lang.String isCollision(java.lang.String pChainName)
                             throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Give the collision state of a chain. If a chain has a collision state "none" or "near", it could be desactivated.

Parameters:
pChainName - The chain name {"Arms", "LArm" or "RArm"}.
Returns:
A string which notice the collision state: "none" there are no collision, "near" the collision is taking in account in the anti-collision algorithm, "collision" the chain is in contact with an other body. If the chain asked is "Arms" the most unfavorable result is given.

                     throws com.aldebaran.qimessaging.CallError,
                            java.lang.InterruptedException

Parameters:
pConfig - Breath configuration. An ALValue of the form [["Bpm", pBpm], ["Amplitude", pAmplitude]]. pBpm is a float between 10 and 50 setting the breathing frequency in beats per minute. pAmplitude is a float between 0 and 1 setting the amplitude of the breathing animation.
